com.spinn3r.api.util
Interface Decoder<E>

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProtoStreamDecoder
public interface Decoder<E>

Interface for writing objects to an output stream. (Or wherever else you want to send them)

Author:
jwu

Method Summary
 int available()
          The number of objects that may be read or skipped without blocking

          Close this decoder.

          Mark the present position in the stream.

          Return true of the mark operation is supported.

          Read an object from the input stream.

          Read a number of objects from the input stream.
 void reset()
          Reset the stream position to the point of the previous mark.
 long skip(long n)
          Skips over and discards n objects in the input stream.

mark

void mark(int readAheadLimit)
          throws java.io.IOException
Mark the present position in the stream. Subsequent calls to reset() will attempt to reposition the stream to this point

Parameters:
readAheadLimit - Limit on the number of characters that may be read while still preserving the mark. After reading this many objects, attempting to reset the stream may fail.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

markSupported

boolean markSupported()
Return true of the mark operation is supported.

Returns:

skip

long skip(long n)
          throws java.io.IOException
Skips over and discards n objects in the input stream. The stream, for a variety of reasons, may skip over fewer than n objects. This method returns the actual number of objects skipped

Parameters:
n -
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException
